Pre-Game Insights: Sri Lanka is eager to make a fresh start and turn their fortunes around after facing a tough challenge against India in a three-match T20I series.
The West Indies recently hosted South Africa in their own T20I series and thrived in familiar conditions, showcasing their skills and strong performance throughout the series.
Historically, the venue favors teams that chase, and this trend is likely to continue.
The team that bowls first will have a significant advantage in securing victory.

The Rangiri Dambulla International Stadium is known for its fast, bouncy pitch that favors pace bowlers.
Sri Lanka's recent performance has been challenging, facing three consecutive losses in their latest matches.
The West Indies team has shown strong form recently, achieving three consecutive victories, demonstrating their skill and teamwork.
Others: Sri Lanka and the West Indies have faced each other in 15 T20I matches, with Sri Lanka winning 8 and the West Indies claiming 7 victories.
